peopleAlsoAsk.question: What 1942 nickel is valuable?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: With its PF68 grade, it's a valuable addition to any collection. The coin features Jefferson on the obverse and was minted in the United States. This 1942 Nickel is a rare find for any coin collector. With its PF68 grade, it's a valuable addition to any collection.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What nickel is worth $10,000 today?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: There are a few nickels that could be worth $10,000 or more, depending on the condition, including the 1913 Liberty V, 1926-S Buffalo, 1880 Shield, 1913-D 3 (or 3-1/2)-Legged Buffalo, and 1943/2 P Jefferson. How rare is a 1943 nickel? 1943 nickels are fairly rare, but they are out there for collectors to find.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: 12 Rare Nickel Coins That Are Worth Money (+ Valuation Tips) - wikiHow

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much is a 1942 to 1945 silver nickel worth today?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Due to the high silver content of War Nickel coins, their intrinsic value far exceeds their face value of five cents. One War Nickel can reach a value of anywhere from $1 to upwards of $1,000 for coins in perfect condition. The lowest mintage year of silver war nickels was in 1942, with just 90,773,000 struck.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: 1942-1945 War Nickel Roll - Only 35% Silver Nickel (40 Coins)

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Are all 1942 D nickels silver?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: You have found mixed answers online because the answer is yes and no. If there is a large letter on the reverse above the image of Monticello, it is silver. If there is no large mint mark above Monticello, it is not silver. 1942 was the only year wherein both silver and non-silver nickels were minted.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Are 1942 nickels silver? : r/coins - Reddit
